structure.unit: SOVEREIGNTY AND JURISDICTION OF THE COMMONWEALTH
GRANTS TO UNITED STATES OF LANDS AND RIGHTS TO ACQUIRE

law.text: Whenever an acceptance or cession of legislative jurisdiction is sought by the United States pursuant to the terms of KRS 3.255 to 3.275, the Governor, prior to negotiating the administrative details of any such acceptance or cession, shall consult with the appropriate local authorities within whose territorial jurisdictions the lands in question lie, including, but not limited to the county judges/executive, the mayors and the sheriffs.
law.history: Created 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 68, sec. 6, effective June 17, 1978.
